title: How to Reconstitute Dried Garlic Granules

steps.headline: Sterilize your jar first by leaving it in boiling water for up to 2 minutes, then drain and dry.
steps.description: Be careful and if you have rubber tipped tongs it makes it much easier to get the jar out of the hot water.

steps.headline: Add the garlic granules up from 1/4 to 1/3rd of the jar.
Add filtered or boiled water at room temperature to fill the jar 2/3rds full.
Screw on lid and leave overnight in the fridge.
The next day, the granules should have swollen and filled the jar.
steps.description: The enzymes in the garlic are "revived" and you would use the same amount as per ordinary garlic. Some garlic granules absorb water at different rates. If it looks a little soupy, add 1/2 tsp more of dried granules and allow these to swell in the same manner.

steps.headline: To cook, use as ordinary chopped garlic in the same quantity and method so instead of using a large amount of dried granules, you are using a much smaller amount for the same flavour.

tyn_section: A pack of ordinary dried garlic granules.
A clean jar with a tight fitting lid (such as an ordinary jam jar), but preferably a small or 100ml size to make an amount you can use up in reasonable time.
